title: Israel–Hezbollah tensions: Tel Aviv launches fresh strikes across Lebanon
description: Israel launched air strikes on Hezbollah sites in Lebanon, targeting weapons facilities and production sites. This follows Lebanon's announcement of disarming the group in the south. While Israel deems the Lebanese army's efforts an encouraging start, it insists full disarmament is necessary, citing ongoing Hezbollah rearmament as a threat.

Why RBI isn't targeting Rupee's price band — the 'impossible trilemma' explained

Why did the RBI allow the currency to slide instead of stepping in to defend it, and why are policymakers insisting they are not worried? The answers lie in a hard economic constraint that leaves central banks with fewer choices than they appear to have.

title: Jay Shah calls Rohit 'our captain'; batter's reaction goes viral - Watch
description: Rohit Sharma smiled with pride after ICC chairman Jay Shah referred to him as India’s captain at a public event, despite him no longer holding the ODI role. The moment went viral online. Rohit led India to the T20 World Cup 2024 and Champions Trophy 2025. Now retired from Tests and T20Is, he is set to play in India’s upcoming ODI series starting January 11.

Shalini Singh, who uses music to impart wisdom to her students, found her lifelong passion recognized. Her journey, supported by family and school, highlights faith, perseverance, and the meaningful impact of sincere dedication.

title: Thirty years ago, a punt helped the country to World Cup triumph
description: To win a Cricket World Cup, all your elements — batting, bowling and fielding — need to collectively work well. Consistency in team efforts, along with a few individuals’ standout performances, makes a team the World Champion. But sometimes a decision, technical or tactical, during the buildup to such a mega event turns out to be a trump card for the team, leading them to massive success.

title: 'Did nothing wrong': Mamata on action during ED raids; makes coal scam charge against BJP
description: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee defended her interference during ED's I-PAC raids, alleging the agency sought to "steal" her party's data. She accused senior BJP leaders in Delhi of receiving "coal scam proceeds" and claimed the BJP won Maharashtra by "stealing the mandate" with EC's help, aiming to do the same in Bengal.

Corey Perry exits Kings after being placed on non-roster status
description: Los Angeles Kings veteran Corey Perry has stepped away from the team after being placed on non-roster status due to a family-related illness. The decision prompted emergency roster moves from the Ontario Reign as the Kings adjusted during the 2025–26 NHL season, with Perry’s leadership and production temporarily absent from the lineup.

title: Open AI 'Code Red' emergency: Google AI CEO drops hint; speaks of 'relentless progress'
description: Google's Gemini is rapidly gaining on ChatGPT, reporting 28% month-over-month growth and capturing nearly 40% of ChatGPT's web audience. This surge has prompted OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to issue an internal "code red" warning, urging a refocus on ChatGPT's core functionality amidst intensifying AI chatbot competition.

title: Stefon Diggs–Cardi B drama becomes Patriots playoff distraction
description: The New England Patriots are winning, but celebrity drama, particularly involving Stefon Diggs and Cardi B, overshadows their on-field success. While quarterback Drake Maye shows promise, Diggs' crucial role in the offense is undeniable. Coach Mike Vrabel attempts to maintain focus amidst the off-field noise, but the team's playoff hopes hinge on managing these distractions.

title: Larry Bird and Dinah Mattingly’s combined net worth and NBA legacy
description: NBA legend Larry Bird, a three-time champion with the Boston Celtics, boasts a remarkable career marked by numerous accolades. Beyond his on-court success, Bird has maintained a private personal life, with two marriages and adopted children. His estimated net worth, combined with his wife, Dinah Mattingly, reflects his enduring career earnings and brand endorsements.

title: Candace Owens sparks new Charlie Kirk questions after unseen image surfaces
description: Candace Owens shared claims about a photo she says shows Charlie Kirk after an alleged shooting. She questioned the official story and named people she said could not be trusted. However, there is no verified evidence, police record, or official confirmation that Charlie Kirk was shot or killed. Her statements remain unproven and widely disputed.

title: Philanthropy push: Bezos’ ex-wife donates billions to non-profits; biggest giveaway in 2025
description: Mackenzie Scott, ex-wife of Amazon's founder, has significantly reduced her stake in the e-commerce giant, selling shares worth $13 billion.  She continues her massive philanthropic efforts, donating $7.1 billion to non-profits in 2025 alone, including over $1.2 billion to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.  These substantial, unrestricted grants are seen as a counterpoint to tech companies scaling back DEI initiatives.

title: Musk impressed with China, says 'Does things I say'; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
description: Elon Musk noted China's rapid adoption of electric vehicles, batteries, and solar power, mirroring his suggestions. He emphasized batteries as key to boosting US energy output without new power plants. Tesla's Megapacks and Megablock offer utility-scale storage solutions. Musk also warned of potential silver price hikes due to Chinese export restrictions.
